1b2ea52b-a049-4aa0-bfac-4795dc44bda5.description: This examination covers broad-based radiation protection knowledge of accelerators; university health physics programs; medical health physics; power reactors; government radiological facilities; radioactive waste disposal; transportation of radioactive material; radiation protection fundamentals; and regulatory requirements.
1b2ea52b-a049-4aa0-bfac-4795dc44bda5.name: National Registry of Radiation Protection Technologists (NRRPT) Passed 8/1/18 - 8/31/22

issuer.summary: issued by National Registry of Radiation Protection Technologists

entity.name: National Registry of Radiation Protection Technologists

badge_template_activities.title: The skills measured include surveys and inspection; emergency preparedness; evaluating internal and external exposure controls; prescribed dosimetry and radiation equipment; contamination control; radioactive material control and transportation; guides and regulations; procedures and programs (ALARA); analytical methods; instrument calibration and maintenance; personnel dosimetry; equipment operations; sources of radiation; biological effects; mathematics; chemistry; physics; and more.

a9a105d3-c7bf-4589-b770-2ead320f8a12.description: To promote technical competence in the radiation protection field at the operational level by establishing a standard of excellence for the radiation protection technologists. The student will be able to demonstrate demonstrate competency of radiation protection practices to assure compliance with various standards and regulations.
a9a105d3-c7bf-4589-b770-2ead320f8a12.name: National Registry of Radiation Protection Technologists (NRRPT) Passed 11/1/78 - 6/27/10

issuer.summary: issued by National Registry of Radiation Protection Technologists

entity.name: National Registry of Radiation Protection Technologists

badge_template_activities.title: The skills measured include evaluate radiological hazards in a variety of situations; safely ship (transport) radioactive material; conduct data reduction and calculations; apply regulations; understand functions of and operate radiation survey and monitoring equipment; know methods of protecting people from radiation exposure; understand the origin, characteristics, and interactions of various types of radiation; and recognize and respond to radiological emergencies.

ca4ecef6-bceb-4ec1-835f-2caad0c76668.description: This multiple-choice exam covers the areas of radiation protection knowledge of accelerators; university health physics programs, medical health physics, power reactors, government radiological facilities, radioactive waste disposal, transportation of radioactive material, fundamentals, and regulatory requirements.
ca4ecef6-bceb-4ec1-835f-2caad0c76668.name: National Registry of Radiation Protection Technologists (NRRPT) Passed 8/1/14 - 7/31/18

issuer.summary: issued by National Registry of Radiation Protection Technologists

entity.name: National Registry of Radiation Protection Technologists

badge_template_activities.title: The skills measured include surveys and inspection; emergency preparedness; evaluating internal and external exposure controls; prescribed dosimetry and radiation equipment; contamination control; radioactive material control and transportation; guides and regulations; procedures and programs (ALARA); analytical methods; instrument calibration and maintenance; personnel dosimetry; equipment operations; sources of radiation; biological effects; mathematics; chemistry; physics; and more.

2cdd33a7-589f-41ff-9bfc-67d5bab04936.description: This certification promotes competency in radiation protection practices and various standards and regulations. Upon successfully passing a proctored, 150-question, closed book examination, personnel will be able to evaluate radiological hazards in a variety of situations; apply regulations; understand the functioning of and operation of radiation survey and monitoring equipment; and utilize methods to minimize personal radiation exposure.

endorsements.description: This credential has been successfully evaluated by the American Council on Education for college credit. It is recommended for a total of 33 college credits. For more information about ACE Learning Evaluations, visit www.acenet.edu.
